Open the ND iOS app 2. Sign into a valid account 3. Go to a Room > Avatar > Upload a larger image to get the error message (Look at the formatting for the error message) 4. Tap on "Room name" & observe the highlight and its interaction with the error message ## Expected Result: The error message should be clean ## Actual Result: The error message is bunched up vertically and when the user taps on the Room name section, the highlight overlaps the error message ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf73a5f9-b2d9-4f78-966d-a9c5809a5f54 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.71-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sustinov@applausemail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 12 PRO/iOS 18.6.2 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisites: The account must have 1 expense in the deleted WS, 1 expense in the existing WS, and 1 expense in Your space. Steps: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Log in with your HT account. 3. Go to Your space 4. Go to Expenses 5. Click on More - Merge 6. Select the expense from the deleted WS - continue 7. Select your own expense and report from the deleted WS - continue ## Expected Result: The application should not crash when combining expenses ## Actual Result: The app crashes when merging expenses ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c5d42a6-27c7-4250-bb3f-c970c058459a [logs.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23913844/logs.txt) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.71-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71220 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jnsdonsoijnods@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click Report field > Create report. 6. Click More > Delete to delete the empty report. 7. Open the new report. → "moved this expense" is not shown when the old report is deleted. 8. Click Report field > Remove from report. 9. Click More > Delete. 10. Go to self DM. 11. Open the unreported expense. ## Expected Result: "moved this expense" will not be shown when the old report is deleted. ## Actual Result: "moved this expense" is shown when the expense is unreported and the old report is deleted. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/420a75a5-0de8-4c85-8a3e-78003dc25d05 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Reports page shows `oops` error after reopening the App

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem 1. User is on the Reports page and backgrounds the App 2. After a while (maybe a full 15min), user reopens the App 3. User sees the Oops error page ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abe8a3f8-4b9f-4a65-9276-276b4d65c363) ### Solution Logs show the following: ``` Got an authorization error Expensify\Error\Auth\AuthTokenExpired - 9b953676-e64d-4262-bf74-1bf0ff888e4d ~~ command: 'Search' exceptionJsonCode: '407' exceptionUserMessage: 'Your session has expired. Please sign in again.' ``` The auth token is probably expiring and we're sending a request to Search before we re-authenticate the user, which leads to the request failing and the error showing. Make sure we re-authenticate first.
